title: Russian Corporate Bonds Rebound as Investors Embrace Risks
sub_head: Distressed-debt investors are driving a recovery in Russian corporates, betting those with foreign assets can pay their debts despite Western sanctions
body:
Russian corporate bond prices are rebounding as some investors sense a potential bargain in the country’s debt markets following a broad rout of Russia-linked assets in the weeks after the invasion of Ukraine.
“Everything has bounced,” said Phil Torres, a senior portfolio manager at Aegon Asset Management specializing in emerging markets, referring to Russian corporate bonds. “When the invasion occurred, you had an understandable knee-jerk reaction to sell everything.”
